cab.content: THIS DOCUMENT IS THE PROPERTY OF HIS BRITANNIC MAJESTVS GOVERNMENTPrinted for the Cabinet. September 1945./SECRET. Copy No.CM. (45)32nd Conclusions.CABINET 32 (45).CONCLUSIONS of a Meeting of the Cabinet held at 10 Downing Street, S.W. 1,on Saturday, 15th September, 1945, at 11-15 a.m.Present:The Right Hon. C. R. Attlee, M.P., Prime Minister (in the Chair).The Right Hon. Ernest Bevin, M.P.,Secretary of State for ForeignAffairs.The Right Hon. Sir Stafford Cripps,K.C, M.P., President of the Boardof Trade.The Right Hon. Viscount Addison,Secretary of State for DominionAffairs.The Right Hon. Viscount Stansgate,Secretary of State for Air.The Right Hon. Hugh Dalton, M.P.,Chancellor of the Exchequer.The Right Hon. J. Chuter Ede, M.P.,Secretary of State for the home department.The Right Hon. Lord Pethick-Lawrence, Secretary of State forIndia and Secretary of State for burma.The Right Hon. G. A. Isaacs, M.P.,Minister of Labour and NationalService.The Right Hon. Aneurin Bevan, M.P.,Minister of Health.The following were also present:Mr. A. Creech Jones, M.P., Parlia-mentary Under-Secretary of Statefor the Colonies.The Hon. Sir Alexander Cadogan,Permanent Under-Secretary of Statefor Foreign Affairs.Admiral of the Fleet Sir andrew cunningham, First Sea Lord and chief of Naval Staff.Lord Nathan, Parliamentary Under-Secretary of State for War.Sir Ronald Campbell, Foreign Office.Lieutenant - General Sir ArchibaldNye, Vice-Chief of the ImperialGeneral Staff.Air Vice-Marshal W. F. Dickson,Assistant Chief of the Air Staff.Secretariat.Sir Edward Bridges.Sir Gilbert Laithwaite.Mr. W. S. Murrie.Major-General E. I. C. Jacob.Contents.Subject. Page.Tripolitania.... .... .... .... .... ... .... 104Colonial Trusteeship.[30725-6] Tripolitania.ColonialTrusteeship.(previous reference:C.M. (45) 30thConclusions,Minute 5.)At their meeting on the 11th September the Cabinet discussed the question of the disposal of the Italian Colonies and authorised the Secretary of State for Foreign Affairs to adopt a certain lineof action in this matter in discussions on the Council of foreign ministers. The Secretary of State for Foreign Affairs now informed the Cabinet of the course which the discussions in the Council ofForeign Ministers had taken. A general discussion followed, the record and the conclusions of which are kept in the Secretary'standard File of Cabinet Conclusions.Cabinet Office, S.W. 1,15th September, 1945.
